result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Carla J Blood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the department.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes:
Jail on count 2 only.
Jail with huber for work/treatment/school or electronic monitoring if defendant qualifies under jail criteria.  
Stay 75 days for rule violations.
Serve 15 days - to start within 60 days.
Court finds defendant is entitled to no days jail credit if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same as shown under count 2 in this file.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on November 11, 2016 at 10:45 am.
amended
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement on count one (diversion program)
Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept. if this has not already been done.  Retain clients with permission of parents.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:27 am 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Def appears in person with Atty John Bartholomew.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to file amended information. COURT grants. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Child Abuse)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 2 (Misd. Battery)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 3 (Child Neglect)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, def guilty of Cts. 2 & 3, and defers entry of judgment on Ct. 1. 
Argument. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1 >> DEOJ for 2 years with conditions as outlined in written agreement. 
                           : On Cts. 2 & 3>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS on both: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; no contact with A.R.W; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; payment of court costs. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITION of probation on Ct. 2 ONLY: 90 days MCJ with huber for work/treatment/school or electronic monitoring if def qualifies under jail criteria - 75 days STAYED for rule violations; 15 days to be served to start within 60 days. 
COURT finds def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 
State notes if def successfully completes DEOJ on Ct. 1, it will move to dismiss that charge. 
Parties request bond modification. 
COURT modifies bond - removes no contact with individuals under the age of 18 provision of bond. 
Review of DEOJ set for November 11, 2016 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 JA. 
Bond Continues as modified. 
Adj: 10:00 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2014 at 09:10 am.
Status conference on September 17, 2014 at 01:20 pm.
Status conference on September 10, 2014 at 01:20 pm.
Status conference on August 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Any and All Evidence Obtained from the Defendant - stj

records.addlTxt: Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.  No contact with minor(s) without supervision of an adult.    Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Retain clients with permission of parents.
Request for adjournment of initial appearance from 3/20/14 to 3/27/14 - approved - stj
